newsitem.title: USA: NYMEX lowers propane contract margins.
newsitem.headline: NYMEX lowers propane contract margins.

text.p: NYMEX, in a move analysts said Monday is possibly designed to boost interest in its propane contract, will decrease the margins on its propane futures.
In a release earlier Monday, NYMEX said the margins will be effective at the close of business April 8.
Analysts said the move could mean NYMEX is not getting enough business for its propane contract.
Decreasing the margin of a futures contract also usually follows a period of volatility, which characterized the propane market this past winter season.
NYMEX would not comment on the move, but said "it is appropriate given market conditions."

NYMEX said the margins will be lowered to $1,200 from $2,110 for clearing members; to $1,320 from $2,321 for members, and to $1,620 from $2,849 for customers. ((--Laney Salisbury, New York Energy Desk 212-859-1631))
